About the job
    


Research & Development – Oral Care – Scientist 
P&G serves consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Ambi Pur®, Ariel®, Bounty®, Charmin®, Crest®, Dawn®, Downy®, Fairy®, Febreze®, Gain®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Lenor®, Olay®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, SK-II®, Tide®, Vicks®, and Whisper®. The P&G community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide. Please visit http://www.pg.com for the latest news and information about P&G and its brands.
We employ nearly 7,000 Research & Development (R&D) employees in 11 countries around the globe. We have state-of-the-art innovation centers and more depth and breadth in science and technology resources than any consumer products company in the world, resulting in over 55,000 patents and applications globally. Our science, Scientists, Engineers, and Researchers consistently receive numerous prestigious awards.
 The Ideal Candidate 
The successful candidate will join the best-in-class group of scientists to grow and advance science and capability development in Oral Care R&D. The ideal candidate will have a PhD in Statistics/Data Science with relevant and practical hands-on experience in consumer research methodology. The individual must have a proven track record of technical problem-solving skills, experience with relevant methods, instruments, software, and ability to bring forward the state-of-the art statistical tools and approaches. The individual’s ability to condense complex information and complex data analysis into simpler models will be a critical aspect of consideration along with the ability to work in teams where statistical experience may be widely variable.
The individual will work in the Health Care Statistics and Data Management section of the Measurement Sciences organization as a unique interface between technology development, formula design, and consumer acceptance of our products. The role will focus on design and analysis of consumer research studies, upskilling the quantitative skills of the organization, development of statistical methods and models in support of Oral Care programs and holistic integration of such methods into the overall technology development and consumer delight processes.
This position also requires effective collaboration and communication skills with multifunctional teams, ability to explain complex statistical concepts to non-experts, and collaboration with a multitude of diverse subject matter experts (formulators, process and data engineers, chemists, clinicians, etc.). This role is critical for improvement of global oral health by delivering superior products of superior quality, and the work directly translates to new technology identification, product development and commercialization for all products in the Oral Care portfolio. This is a unique opportunity to be part of a fast-moving and agile global team to grow and shape the future of Oral Care.
IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL:
Provide leading edge statistical and data science expertise for the Oral Care products R&D organization to guide project direction and compliment consumer understandingProvide statistical expertise for experimental design, analysis, interpretation and reporting of consumer research studiesApply statistical and data science expertise to claims and credentialing support, predictive modeling, image/video analysis, automating analysis when appropriate, and upskilling the quantitative skills of the organizationProvide exploratory data analysis of the consumer data lake and other sources of data to extract maximum value from existing dataLeverage advanced statistical and data science methods to integrate learnings in consumer, sensory and business analytics and activate data to drive business decisionsGenerate and apply end-to-end models to drive activation of learnings to the business in partnership with a Consumer Products Research ScientistWork on a wide variety of projects with various teams where each project could be vastly different all at the same time
Qualifications
PhD in Statistics / Data Science with relevant and practical hands-on experience in consumer research methodology (ex. Multivariate such as clustering, discrete choice such as Conjoint and MaxDiff, Random effects mixed models for crossover studies, Neural and Convolutional Neural Networks, correlated regression techniques, etc). Experience in using various Statistical/Data Science software packages (ex.R, SAS, Python, JMP)

About the job
    


About our Data Science Team! 
At P&G we innovate and discover, we research and collaborate, we make the world a better place by the improving everyday lives of 5 billion people around the world who use and enjoy our products.  We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our dynamic and diverse team to lead Machine Learning or Operations Research.
Ask yourself …
 W ould you enjoy solving billion-dollar data science problems across trillions of data points?  How would you like to own a complex modeling pipeline end-to-end, in close partnership with business leadership?  Would you like to work with innovative data science technology and have access to the state-of-the-art infrastructure?  Would you be interested in turning untidy data into non-obvious insights, challenging the ways the business is done and surprising business leaders with the power of algorithms? 
If this answer is YES , t hen look no further because a long-term career in Data Science at P&G is something we cultivate from Day 1 ! At P&G, you will find yourself among a team of diverse and dynamic professionals who are interested in your ideas, willing to help you to explore them, see them through, and collectively learn from them. You will find yourself in an environment where discussion and experimentation are encouraged and where failed experiment is seen as a learning opportunity rather than personal failure.  We move forward by collaboration and share the results of our work, we debate the ideas, and we always respect each other , w e call it the  “ Learning Culture .” 
 The Opportunity 
At P&G, our goal is to empower the business with the algorithms, to augment every important business decision with the superior insights provided by the models. As a Data Scientist for P&G you will drive productivity and impact our business results across a variety of platforms.
Here are a few examples.
 As a Media and Marketing Data Scientist, you will apply predictive power of algorithms to maximize returns and optimize P&G media spend.   As a Digital Commerce Data Scientist, you will take methodology of modeling to the e- r etail environment, harvesting power of the big data to grow our digital sales through partnering with leading global retailers.  As a Supply Chain Data Scientist, you will use optimization and simulation techniques to refine and streamline our manufacturing and supply chain.  As a Model Risk Officer, you will partner with other Data Scientists to help improve and validate their models to ensure they are futureproofed. 
 In this role you will 
 Lead cross functional teams of Data Scientist, Data Engineers , and Software Developers from the hypothesis to the finished product.   Partner with other IT Functions and Business Leaders to build strategy, execute roadmaps for a large organization and communicate to the highest level of the company leadership.  Build and lead a high performing Data Science team, drive professional development of the team members.  Apply thorough technical and business knowledge to feature engineering of massive datasets, exploratory data analysis, and model building to deliver accurate and impactful business insights.  Translate analytic insights into concrete, actionable recommendations for business or product improvement.  Quantify improvement in business areas resulting from use of the algorithms and modeling.  Self-motivated individual with a d emonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities with a can-do attitude and strong enthusiasm for their body of work. 
Qualifications
 Required 
 5+ years of relevant work experience in Data Science organization, preferably in the CPG (Consumer Packaged Goods) industry.  Master’s degree or higher is preferred in a quantitative field (Operation Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Math, Statistics, Physics, Analytics, etc.) or have equivalent work experience.  Record of accomplishment of building scalable customer facing machine learning products.  Knowledge and application of s cientific c omputing methods i.e., Python, R, Scala 
Preferred Qualifications
 Experience in one of more advanced analytic mythologies such as Machine Learning, Optimization, Simulation .  Experience with large data sets and cloud computin g.  Experience with Dev Ops environment: Git, CICD, etc. 
P&G is an equal opportunity employer.
